alert.note: Alert for Brown; Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 11:56PM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota... Mud Creek near Brentford affecting Spink and Brown Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mud Creek near Brentford. * WHEN...From early this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1274.0 feet, water reaches the bottom of the bridge on 149th Street. At 1275.0 feet, 149th Street begins to flood, and low lying agricultural lands begin to flood. At 1276.0 feet, significant agricultural flooding begins. At 1277.0 feet, water reaches the bottom of the bridge on 148th Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 1275.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 AM CDT Saturday was 1275.4 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 1275.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Sunday, or sooner if necessary.
